feed.title: Fwd: bitcoin scope issue in main.cpp

entry.title: Fwd: bitcoin scope issue in main.cpp
entry.summary: In a conversation from October 23, 2011, a member of the Bitcoin-development mailing list named 'JS' commented that they knew it was legal for a scope to define variables with names that conflict with variables in higher-level scopes. They argued that using all of the "This is legal in C++" tricks in the Bitcoin source code would make it even less maintainable and readable than it already was. The email thread also included a message from 'theymos', who shared information about the growing demand for IT networking professionals and encouraged readers to take a complimentary Learning at Cisco Self-Assessment to learn more about Cisco certifications, training, and career opportunities.
